      • notifySearch

        public java.util.Queue<Robot> notifySearch(java.lang.String name,
                                           java.lang.String team,
                                           java.lang.String minWins,
                                           java.lang.String maxWins,
                                           java.lang.String minLosses,
                                           java.lang.String maxLosses,
                                           java.lang.String minGamesPlayed,
                                           java.lang.String maxGamesPlayed,
                                           boolean currentOnly)
                                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Called when the user presses the search button. Should return a list of robots to update the view with
        Parameters:
        name - the name to search
        team - the team name to search
        minWins - the max wins for the robot
        maxWins - the min wins for the robot
        minLosses - the max losses for the robot
        maxLosses - the min wins for the robot
        minGamesPlayed - the min number of matches played for the robot
        maxGamesPlayed - the max number of matches played for the robot
        currentOnly - whether to return all versions, or just the current
        Returns:
        A queue of robots representing all robots on the server with those parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - thrown if one of the text fields does not contain an integer
